Articles.Content:
OK, thanks.... I will be happy when this one comes back..... It is one of the MUST HAVE mods in my list(s)...

Cheers.
Have there been any thoughts to hosting this mod on KerbalStuff?

One of my must-haves and it's been offline for two versions now...

The agony...

...is...

...unbearable!

One of my must-haves and it's been offline for two versions now...

The agony...

...is...

...unbearable!

Agreed. This is a spectacular mod that really adds to the immersion of the game. Here's hoping it gets added to the RO must-haves if/when it comes out.

Just wanna add like the others; this is such an immersive, wonderfully detailed and accurate mod, I desperately await the next release/fix /

Edited November 24, 2014 by pingopete
With pizza seeming to be back, it's my dearest hope he revisits this sooner rather than later. Cheers.
I'd also want to express my hope that this mod comes back!
Me too, this mod is a must have. My ears need supersonic boom

Honestly im surprised someone hasn't made any other atmospheric sound mods since. Its been a year since I last tried this yet back even when it worked it was still inconsistent. But the fading of the engines as the atmosphere thins was a hell of an effect. I see a few major mods and there authors still even recommend this. So does it still work to a degree? I read it doesn't support the new fx system, but well... im using smokescreen/HotRockets. So I don't know. Is it even worth trying?

Honestly im surprised someone hasn't made any other atmospheric sound mods since. Its been a year since I last tried this yet back even when it worked it was still inconsistent. But the fading of the engines as the atmosphere thins was a hell of an effect. I see a few major mods and there authors still even recommend this. So does it still work to a degree? I read it doesn't support the new fx system, but well... im using smokescreen/HotRockets. So I don't know. Is it even worth trying?

From my experience in 0.25 it does not, just makes intermittent clicking and popping sounds

Honestly im surprised someone hasn't made any other atmospheric sound mods since. Its been a year since I last tried this yet back even when it worked it was still inconsistent. But the fading of the engines as the atmosphere thins was a hell of an effect. I see a few major mods and there authors still even recommend this. So does it still work to a degree? I read it doesn't support the new fx system, but well... im using smokescreen/HotRockets. So I don't know. Is it even worth trying?

probaly cause sounds seem to take up as much ram as textures with ksp it seems. for me chatter alone takes up like 100mb of ram use

Honestly im surprised someone hasn't made any other atmospheric sound mods since. Its been a year since I last tried this yet back even when it worked it was still inconsistent. But the fading of the engines as the atmosphere thins was a hell of an effect. I see a few major mods and there authors still even recommend this. So does it still work to a degree? I read it doesn't support the new fx system, but well... im using smokescreen/HotRockets. So I don't know. Is it even worth trying?

No, it doesn't work at all currently. I'm working on it at the moment. It works correctly for about three seconds before it stops working for the rest of the scene's duration. I'm investigating it. Something in the stock AudioFX module seems to be deleted and recreated, taking the added effects with it.

probaly cause sounds seem to take up as much ram as textures with ksp it seems. for me chatter alone takes up like 100mb of ram use

This mod adds no sound files whatsoever. Everything is generated dynamically using AudioFilters, so your CPU will be hit rather than your RAM.
Since nobody seems to have said it yet, with the exception of the known issue with the new FX module, this works fine in 0.90.

Since nobody seems to have said it yet, with the exception of the known issue with the new FX module, this works fine in 0.90.

It runs better than it did before at dealing with ambient sound BUT doesn't appear to effect any engine sounds they remain constant right into space
Thanks for the replies folks. Yea I hope one day this can come back to life. Kerbquake as well. That mod together with ASE was simply amazing.
Kerbquake is "continued" here -- seems to be working in .90 http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/98583-0-25-KerbQuake-continued-v1-2-1-Reactive-Camera-Shakes-while-IVA-2014-10-29

It runs better than it did before at dealing with ambient sound BUT doesn't appear to effect any engine sounds they remain constant right into space

Weird, the engines all fade out for me.

I have found that the orange radially mounted engine (can't recall its name) uses the new FX module but the T45 and T30 still go silent in vacuum and the jet engines go silent above Mach 1.

Hmmm I still get some engines emitting sound beyond shack cone and in vaccume despite changes config values to realistic. Must be to do with the particular engines, I'm using RSS type engines so there could be some config clash or something.

Hmmm I still get some engines emitting sound beyond shack cone and in vaccume despite changes config values to realistic. Must be to do with the particular engines, I'm using RSS type engines so there could be some config clash or something.

I'm having this same problem too. When I decouple an engine (or jet engine), what I presume to be the most recent engine effect given off by that engine randomly spurts on and off at around 10 per 8 seconds. It is from this mod. Not sure how to fix though.

Also this is from an old version. Is this going to be updated any time?

Hmmm I still get some engines emitting sound beyond shack cone and in vaccume despite changes config values to realistic. Must be to do with the particular engines, I'm using RSS type engines so there could be some config clash or something.

I've not used RSS yet but my understanding is that RSS engines are config'd for HotRockets which does break ASE so maybe that's what's causing the issue.
I would hope an update is in the works for this, as it was one of my favorite mods for a while and one I thought should be stockified
@Jaxx Pizzaoverhead told me he's planning on remaking/updating this mod in the future. I'm not sure when as he also said he's quite a busy man, but I look forward to when it is released .
I've been working on it this week. Finally making some good progress.

hello friend there is a possibility of this mod out for version

0.90 , I love it because it makes the game more realistic

I've been working on it this week. Finally making some good progress.

YAY! This mod is so good! Carry on, dude!
